title: theme css changes sometimes ignored
body:
### expected behaviour
when modifying the theme using the /themes/*theme_name*/ structure as documented in the themes readme file. **all** css changes should be obeyed.

### actual behaviour
some changes in css are not obeyed. specifically changes made to the "log in" button colors on the log in page in styles.css

### steps to reproduce
1. create a /themes/*theme_name*/core/css/ directory
2. copy the /core/css/styles.css file to your *theme_name*/core/css directory
3. find and modify the "background:" color in the following section in the above file
```
.primary, input[type="submit"].primary, input[type="button"].primary, button.primary, .button.primary {
        border:1px solid #1d2d44;
        background:#35537a; color:#ddd; text-shadow:#000 0 -1px 0;
        -moz-box-shadow:0 0 1px #000,0 1px 1px #6d7d94 inset; -webkit-box-shadow:0 0 1px #000,0 1px 1px #6d7d94 inset; box-shadow:0 0 1px #000,0 1px 1px #6d7d94 inset;
}
```
4. save the theme file
5. modify your config.php to load the theme you just created
6. load the log in page

### server configuration
operating system: rhel 6.3

web server: httpd-2.2.22-25.el6.ctisl.x86_64

database: mysql-server-5.1.69-1.el6_4.x86_64

php version: php-5.3.3-23.el6_4.x86_64

owncloud version: 5.0.10

### client configuration
browser: firefox 24.0 and chromium-browser 27

operating system: fedora 18

## workaround
in order to modify these ignored items, you must modify the /core/css/styles.css file, rather than the theme's styles.css file. these changes, however, will be overridden during future software updates.

## possible cause
i am no jquery expert (in fact, quite the opposite) but from what i can tell by poking around with the element inspector is that the php/jquery files are reading from the css files in /core/css/ rather than /themes/*theme_name*/core/css when theme => is specified in config.php.
